content:
• Wednesday, January 2, 2013
  • QRE

    QR Energy (NYSE:QRE) has acquired $145M of oil properties located in the Jay field in the...

    QR Energy (NYSE:QRE) has acquired $145M of oil properties located in the Jay field in the Florida Gulf Coast area from its sponsor, Quantum Resources Fund. The deal was closed on Friday and was financed with cash and borrowings under the firm's bank credit facility. Current net production from the mature wells comes to approximately 2500 Boed (90% oil and 10% NGLs), with estimated reserves of 11.3M Boe as of December 31. FY13 adjusted EBITDA for the properties is expected to exceed $35M. Shares +1.21% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 PM | 6 Comments
  • BGMD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OTC:BGMD +14%. KYAK +8%. SZYM +6%. LNDC +4%. NAVB +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OTC:BGMD +14%. KYAK +8%. SZYM +6%. LNDC +4%. NAVB +3%.
    After-hours top losers: MLNX -16%. RMBS -12%. ESIO -8%. AUO -6%. OME -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) has resumed trading following its big Q4 warning. Shares are currently...

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) has resumed trading following its big Q4 warning. Shares are currently down 20.1% to $48.92. That leaves them down 59% from September's all-time high, but still up 48% from where they stood a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • LNDC

    Landec Corporation (NASDAQ:LNDC) restates 1QFY13 financial to report an increase of $2.9M in...

    Landec Corporation (NASDAQ:LNDC) restates 1QFY13 financial to report an increase of $2.9M in fair value of Windset Holdings. The company understated the recorded value of its Windset investment, and the related investment income, by $2.9 million, thus impacting net income by $1.8M, or $0.07/share. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -2.3%) finish the day well into negative territory despite a higher...

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -2.3%) finish the day well into negative territory despite a higher opening in response to an earlier upbeat research note from D.A. Davidson's Timothy Ramey, calling the company a best idea for 2013. Ramey cites a possible takeout bid or a potential deal for HLF to snap up a peer. He says growth could accelerate this year given that forex should be less of a drag, and sales out of China are likely to become a significant part of it's revenue model. The firm maintains a Buy rating with $72 price target over the near term, while its long-term target remains at $120.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) warns it expects Q4 revenue of $119M-$121M, well below prior guidance of...

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) warns it expects Q4 revenue of $119M-$121M, well below prior guidance of $145M-$150M and a consensus of $148.3M. The company blames weaker demand, macro issues, and a "technical issue" related to cables for its 56 Gb/s InfiniBand hardware that caused $20M in orders to be delayed; Mellanox claims the cabling issue is fixed. Shares are halted, expect a big move lower. (institutional selling: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • LODE

    Comstock Mining (LODE -4.8%) files for a ~31.1M-share common stock offering by selling...

    Comstock Mining (LODE -4.8%) files for a ~31.1M-share common stock offering by selling stockholders; LODE will receive no proceeds from the secondary offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • MNK

    Shares of Questcor (QCOR -2.6%) are on the move again after UnitedHealthcare (UNH -0.1%)...

    Shares of Questcor (QCOR -2.6%) are on the move again after UnitedHealthcare (UNH -0.1%) announces in a network bulletin that, effective April 1, 2013, the insurer will require physicians to submit for prior authorization and approval of Acthar for its plan members.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 6 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo's (GEVO +17.5%) plan to repurchase as much as $15M of its stock this year may be a sign the...

    Gevo's (GEVO +17.5%) plan to repurchase as much as $15M of its stock this year may be a sign the company is making progress in its efforts to resume production of isobutanol at its Minnesota plant. Gevo's job now is to "regain a bit of credibility after the snafu they had in production," a Piper Jaffray analyst says. "This may be the first sign things are starting to move in the right direction." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • POL

    Coverage of PolyOne (POL +7.7%) is assumed with a Buy rating and $24 price target at Jefferies,...

    Coverage of PolyOne (POL +7.7%) is assumed with a Buy rating and $24 price target at Jefferies, prompted by the recent acquisition of advanced composite materials producer Glasform to strengthen its specialty portfolio in key niche specialty end markets. The firm expects the deal to be modestly accretive and to generate a ROIC of more than 9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • CBPO

    China Biologic Products (CBPO -4.6%) slips after announcing earlier today that construction of a...

    China Biologic Products (CBPO -4.6%) slips after announcing earlier today that construction of a new production facility at its Guizhou Taibang subsidiary could be delayed due to slower-than-expected government approval of land use rights. The Company says it's working closely with local authorities to secure approval as soon as possible and will provide an update as soon as possible. CBPO had planned to commence work on the project in late 2012, with completion by mid-2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • EGC

    Energy XXI (EXXI +1.5%) shares settle down after an earlier rally based on takeover talk from...

    Energy XXI (EXXI +1.5%) shares settle down after an earlier rally based on takeover talk from DealReporter, which says the company could be the next to attract major interest following Freeport McMoRan's recent deals. Another report notes a flurry of recent insider buying at EXXI.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • COG

    Gas producers are missing out on today's rally, as a forecast that colder-than-average weather...

    Gas producers are missing out on today's rally, as a forecast that colder-than-average weather in most of the U.S. this week would give way to above-normal temperatures leads to a sharp drop in natural gas prices. The late-2012 run-up in nat gas was driven by hopes of a cold winter and not fundamentals, Argus’ Phil Weiss adds. COG -3%, CNX -3.9%, BTU -3.2%, EQT -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • TEVA

    NuPathe (PATH +2.5%) says the U.S. Patent & Trademark Office has accepted its patent...

    NuPathe (PATH +2.5%) says the U.S. Patent & Trademark Office has accepted its patent application for iontophoretic patches, a migraine treatment containing the company's proprietary hydrogel polyamine formulation. The company expects the patent to be issued within the next few months, and should provide additional patent protection for its existing migraine treatment Zecuity.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • LECO

    Lincoln Electric (LECO +1.5%) has acquired Tennessee Rand Inc., a privately held manufacturer of...

    Lincoln Electric (LECO +1.5%) has acquired Tennessee Rand Inc., a privately held manufacturer of tooling and robotic systems for welding applications. Financial terms of the agreement were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • LDK

    Solar stocks are outperforming once more today (TAN +4.2%). Short-covering and a general...

    Solar stocks are outperforming once more today (TAN +4.2%). Short-covering and a general migration to risk assets are helping, and so might a fresh solar project purchase from Berkshire Hathaway's MidAmerican Energy (previous). Some of the big winners: LDK +9.7%. SPWR +7.7%. GTAT +7.3%. STP +7.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • VIAB

    Viacom (VIAB +5.7%) trades higher after pestering fears the fiscal cliff would spark an...

    Viacom (VIAB +5.7%) trades higher after pestering fears the fiscal cliff would spark an advertising slowdown abate and a key last-minute deal is struck with Cablevision to keep the company's slate of programming available to Cablevision customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • DVAX

    Dynavax Technologies (DVAX +3%) moves up with the overall market today, shrugging off a...

    Dynavax Technologies (DVAX +3%) moves up with the overall market today, shrugging off a less-than-stellar initiation at JPMorgan with a Neutral rating. The firm cites certain regulatory risks associated with DVAX's hepatitis B vaccine Heplisav. The stock dropped 47% in November after the FDA panel gave its decision that the drug's safety data was inadequate. Heplisav is an adjuvant vaccine that regulators say might cause autoimmune diseases.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • FB

    In addition to JPMorgan, Evercore and Morgan Stanley have issued bullish notes on Facebook (FB...

    In addition to JPMorgan, Evercore and Morgan Stanley have issued bullish notes on Facebook (FB +5.4%), which is back above $28 today. MS predicts mobile will account from 20% of Facebook's Q4 sales, and predicts Gifts will soon be a meaningful top-line contributor.Â  Evercore pegs mobile's Q4 contribution at 24%. Also, all 3 analysts are high on Facebook's ad exchange. Cowen has launched coverage at Neutral, believing sales estimates are too high, but the Street doesn't seem to care.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • WGP

    Western Gas Equity Partners (WGP +6.8%) surges after at least two firms start coverage with...

    Western Gas Equity Partners (WGP +6.8%) surges after at least two firms start coverage with strong ratings. Barclays initiates at Overweight, forecasting WGP will be able to grow distribution by 41% in 2013 and 30% in 2014. Citigroup comes in at Buy, saying units remain attractive given the visibility to multiple years of double-digit growth supported by strong midstream fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • GLDD

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD +7%) moves up after acquiring the assets of Terra...

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD +7%) moves up after acquiring the assets of Terra Contracting, a provider of remediation services for environmental, maintenance and infrastructure-related applications for approximately $20M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • CAR

    Midday top 10 gainers: ZIP +48%. BIOF +28%. STXS +25%. OTC:GIGA +21%. FORD +19%. IQNT +20%. EGLE...

    Midday top 10 gainers: ZIP +48%. BIOF +28%. STXS +25%. OTC:GIGA +21%. FORD +19%. IQNT +20%. EGLE +18%. OTT +18%. GEVO +17%. APAGF +17%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ABT -51%. SKUL -14%. DOLE -13%. TRIT -12%. ATAI -12%. HMNY -9%. CHRM -9%. NTLS -9%. VSCI -8%. MR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • DECK

    Sterne Agee's Sam Poser defends Deckers Outdoor (DECK -4.6%) by saying final sales results for...

    Sterne Agee's Sam Poser defends Deckers Outdoor (DECK -4.6%) by saying final sales results for Ugg products were "less worse" than anticipated over the last part of December. Naturally, the bull-leaning analyst recommends buying shares off today's weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • NG

    NovaGold (NG +5.8%) says it received C$46M from the exercise of warrants held by Electrum...

    NovaGold (NG +5.8%) says it received C$46M from the exercise of warrants held by Electrum Strategic Resources, which has increased its stake in NG to 27.2%. By exercising its warrants, Electrum and affiliates also now hold 27.2% of NovaCopper (NCQ +9.6%), which was spun off from NG last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • LPIH

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +11.8%) raises its FY 2013 guidance to $667M from an earlier $646M and...

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +11.8%) raises its FY 2013 guidance to $667M from an earlier $646M and projects net income to grow ~23% Y/Y to $80M vs. a prior $77.6M forecast, driven by the better-than-expected ramp-up of the new Huajie facility. LPH now expects Huajie revenue contribution of $121M, up 21% from the prior forecast of $100M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • DOLE

    Shares of Dole Food (DOLE -13.3%) fall after the company issues some comments over the...

    Shares of Dole Food (DOLE -13.3%) fall after the company issues some comments over the "challenging" banana market environment. A 14% loss to the supply of bananas in the Asia market due to a typhoon and aggressive moves by importers in North America are factors mentioned by the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • MD

    Mednax (MD +4.4%) says it's acquired Anesthesiologists Associated, a private physician group...

    Mednax (MD +4.4%) says it's acquired Anesthesiologists Associated, a private physician group practice in Tennessee that provides anesthesia services, and Pediatric Surgical and Associates, a pediatric surgery physician group practice in North Texas. The due diligence process for both acquisitions has already been conducted over the last several months, so both acquisitions closed just under the wire on December 31, 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • PDH

    PetroLogistics (PDH +2.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus following a review of...

    PetroLogistics (PDH +2.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus following a review of the updated CMAI forecast for propylene and propane. The firm remains confident in PDH's ability to fix the current operational issue at its facility and meet current demand with inventory, and says the current propane-to-propylene spread forecast indicates a warmer FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • DELL

    EMC's (EMC -2.2%) Q4 sales will come in at the low end of its $5.92B-$6.07B guidance range,...

    EMC's (EMC -2.2%) Q4 sales will come in at the low end of its $5.92B-$6.07B guidance range, thinks Oppenheimer after conducting U.S. and European checks; the consensus stands at $5.98B. 23% of Oppenheimer's contacts expect sub-5% Q/Q growth in EMC sales in seasonally strong Q4 (up from 15% a year ago). Also, the firm thinks sales of EMC's Data Domain de-duplication hardware and Avamar backup/recovery gear are slowing, though demand for its mid-range VNXe systems (competes with NTAP) is strong. EMC and VMware (VMW -0.4%) are underperforming.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • FBIO

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO +6.2%) gets a pop after naming Harlan F. Weisman, M.D., as its new...

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO +6.2%) gets a pop after naming Harlan F. Weisman, M.D., as its new chairman and CEO. Dr. Weisman has been a director for the company since August 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +8.8%) says the Antelope-3 well reached total depth on Dec. 25, and independent...

    InterOil (IOC +8.8%) says the Antelope-3 well reached total depth on Dec. 25, and independent analysis demonstrates a carbonate reservoir with similar reefal reservoir character and quality as the offset Antelope-1 and Antelope-2 wells. Also, IOC extends liquefied natural gas project agreements with Mitsui and Energy World Corp.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial (HAIN +4.5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform at BMO this morning,...

    Hain Celestial (HAIN +4.5%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform at BMO this morning, saying that the natural-foods company still has a compelling story, despite concerns over a slowdown in growth. BMO cites accelerating trends in some key U.S. markets, noting the company is in a good position to generate high-single-digit top-line growth domestically, while U.K. revamps should also be strong.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • AAPL

    As Apple (AAPL +2.7%) delivers another strong performance, Topeka's Brian White predicts the...

    As Apple (AAPL +2.7%) delivers another strong performance, Topeka's Brian White predicts the next iPhone will arrive in the May-June timeframe, and says checks indicate it will be offered in multiple screen sizes. Additional colors are also seen as a possibility. Steve Wozniak and others have been calling on Apple to offer a bigger iPhone, as the popularity of 4.5"+ Android devices such as Samsung's Galaxy S III contribute to its huge international share gains. References to a new iPhone are already turning up in Apple developer logs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 24 Comments
  • TAT

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT +8.4%) announces a 2013 capital expenditure budget of $113M, and...

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT +8.4%) announces a 2013 capital expenditure budget of $113M, and expects 2013 production of 1.8M-2.1M boe/day, or an average production rate of 5K-7K boe/day; crude oil is expected to account for ~60% of production volumes. TAT also says it is evolving toward a hub-and-spoke corporate structure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • LRCX

    Chip stocks are outperforming (SOXX +3.4%) after the SIA reports global chip sales rose 8.5% Y/Y...

    Chip stocks are outperforming (SOXX +3.4%) after the SIA reports global chip sales rose 8.5% Y/Y in November, albeit while falling 1.3% M/M. Though year-ago figures were depressed by an inventory correction and some were expecting a M/M increase, the sector has already priced in quite a bit of bad news. Equipment maker Lam Research (LRCX +5.5%) is one of the standouts after D.A. Davidson starts coverage with a Buy and $56 PT.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • BYD

    Casino stocks trade higher after Macau numbers come in strong enough to keep optimism humming...

    Casino stocks trade higher after Macau numbers come in strong enough to keep optimism humming right along. With U.S.-based gaming companies such as Boyd Gaming (BYD +4.5%), Penn National Gaming (PENN +3%), and Pinnacle Entertainment (PNK +4.2%) also showing strength, it might appear that a fiscal cliff relief rally could also be in play if it wasn't for the strong December already put in by the group.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • BECN

    Beacon Roofing Supply (BECN +2.8%) gets a boost after saying earlier that it's appointed Chief...

    Beacon Roofing Supply (BECN +2.8%) gets a boost after saying earlier that it's appointed Chief Accounting Officer Rick Welker as acting CFO to succeed the recently retired David Grace.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • EBS

    Emergent Biosolutions (EBS +4%) gains this morning after announcing that its experimental drug...

    Emergent Biosolutions (EBS +4%) gains this morning after announcing that its experimental drug TRU-016, a potential treatment for chronic lymphocytic leukemia, was designated as an orphan medicinal product by the European Commission. The drug received its orphan drug status from the FDA in the U.S. in 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • AT

    Atlantic Power (AT +2.4%) says the ~300 MW Canadian Hills wind project has achieved...

    Atlantic Power (AT +2.4%) says the ~300Â MW Canadian Hills wind project has achieved commercial operations and that it has fully repaid the project’s $272M construction loan. Combined with the closing of its Ridgeline acquisition, AT says it is adding 450 net MW of generating capacity to its portfolio, an increase of 20%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • ACHN

    SA author Regarded Solutions bangs the table for Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +5.1%), citing...

    SA author Regarded Solutions bangs the table for Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +5.1%), citing its "wonderful balance sheet" and its four hepatitis C drugs, which could, "for all intents and purposes," cure the illness if approved. Achillion's promise has brought it several upgrades and made it a potential takeover target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • BIOF

    Biofuel firms enjoy notable strength in early trading, as the fiscal cliff deal includes relief...

    Biofuel firms enjoy notable strength in early trading, as the fiscal cliff deal includes relief for all sorts of renewable energy. BIOF +24.7%, SYNM +24.1%, GEVO +10.4%, REGI +9.2%, SZYM +5.9%, PEIX +4.8%, FF +4%, AMRS +3.9%, ADM +3.4%, KIOR +2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (SKUL -9.4%) plummets to new post-IPO lows after receiving a two-notch downgrade to...

    Skullcandy (SKUL -9.4%) plummets to new post-IPO lows after receiving a two-notch downgrade to Underperform from Jefferies, which cites a lack of pricing power and growing competition. The headphone vendor, which had 39.7% of its float shorted as of Dec. 14, now trades at 7x estimated 2012 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 5 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ +5.6%) rockets higher out of the gate after Bloomberg makes note of comments in the...

    H-P (HPQ +5.6%) rockets higher out of the gate after Bloomberg makes note of comments in the company's FY12 10-K (filed on Dec. 27) about evaluating "the potential disposition of assets and businesses that may no longer help us meet our objectives." Wasn't Leo Apotheker kicked out in part for trying to do something similar? Regardless, H-P's FQ4 figures show there's no shortage of units that potentially meet its description.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • CAR

    Shares of Avis Budget (CAR +4%) show strength after the company picks up Zipcar for a hefty...

    Shares of Avis Budget (CAR +4%) show strength after the company picks up Zipcar for a hefty premium. Almost loss in the buzz over the deal is the news that the car rental company is backing its 2012 profit guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • ACTG

    Acacia (ACTG +4.1%) opens with a solid gain after disclosing it has settled yet another IP...

    Acacia (ACTG +4.1%) opens with a solid gain after disclosing it has settled yet another IP dispute (previous), this time with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL). The settlement, whose terms aren't shared, puts to rest a patent suit in a Texas district court.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR) +5.2% premarket after announcing a joint operating agreement with...

    Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR) +5.2% premarket after announcing a joint operating agreement with privately-held Eclipse Resources covering an existing mineral leasehold position owned by both companies in the Marcellus and Utica shale formations in Ohio. MHR says each company will own ~47% working interest under the agreement.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Global markets are giddy with joy after Congress skids to a halt at the fiscal...

    Market preview: Global markets are giddy with joy after Congress skids to a halt at the fiscal cliff with a sharp hand-brake U-Turn that leaves the back tires hanging over the edge. S&P benchmark futures are +1.9%. However, the excitement will probably be short-lived, as there's the small matter of the debt ceiling to be dealt with, not to mention $110B of automatic cuts that were delayed for two months. Later: ISM Manufacturing Index, Construction Spending, FOMC minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • MT

    Markets like ArcelorMittal's (NYSE:MT) agreement to sell a 15% stake in its Canadian iron ore...

    Markets like ArcelorMittal's (NYSE:MT) agreement to sell a 15% stake in its Canadian iron ore unit to a consortium of Asian investors, believing it will help the steelmaker reduce its substantial debt. Macquarie says the deal's implied $7.3B valuation for the mining operations is “an excellent result” for MT, and could be a sign the company "believes the iron ore cycle is past its peak.” MT +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • BP

    BP and its partners in the Shah Deniz project are reportedly facing a cost increase of as much...

    BP and its partners in the Shah Deniz project are reportedly facing a cost increase of as much as $5B to develop the second phase of the Caspian Sea gas field off Azerbaijan. The partners already have approved spending of $6B on construction of platforms and infrastructure next year. Nevertheless, BP +1.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGYP) +18.4% after the company says that its plecanatide oral...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGYP) +18.4% after the company says that its plecanatide oral treatment for chronic constipation due to an unknown cause met the primary and secondary goals of a Phase IIb/III study. Chronic constipation is the most common digestive complaint in the world, with about 15%, or 45M people, suffering in the U.S. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • X

    U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) +3.9% premarket after shares are upgraded to Outperform from Neutral at...

    U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) +3.9% premarket after shares are upgraded to Outperform from Neutral at Credit Suisse, which believes the U.S. steel sector is poised to rebound on the fiscal cliff resolution, attractive fundamentals and upside risk to China. Recent checks support improving U.S. demand, disciplined supply and low inventories, which support higher steel prices. Also: CLF +4.6%, AKS +4.5%, NUE +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) +7.3% premarket, as the company’s low valuation and the chance to lock in...

    Molycorp (MCP) +7.3% premarket, as the company’s low valuation and the chance to lock in rare-earth resources could make it a potential takeover target, Bloomberg reports. Analysts say manufacturers from Nissan (OTCPK:NSANY) to Siemens (SI) could be interested, and shares could fetch $15 in a takeover.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) jumps 6.3% after being the subject of a number of articles describing the...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) jumps 6.3% after being the subject of a number of articles describing the strength of the Lumia line, including from SA author Muhammad Bazil, who writes that "Nokia's much needed breakthrough could be somewhere in China." The Lumia 920T sold out within just two hours of its Shanghai debut, "underscoring huge demand for the device." Also see here and here.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 5 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is reiterated a Buy at JPMorgan, which increases its price target to $35...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is reiterated a Buy at JPMorgan, which increases its price target to $35 from $29. Shares +3.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) makes it onto Evercore's Conviction Buy list as the firm's top...

    Bank ofÂ America (NYSE:BAC) makes it onto Evercore's Conviction Buy list as the firm's top large-cap bank pick. Shares +3.6% premarket, rising above $12 each for the first time in 19 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 1 Comment

  • U.S. stock futures join the global party after Congress just about averts the fiscal cliff, for...

    U.S. stock futures join the global party after Congress just about averts the fiscal cliff, for now. However, "the excitement will evaporate, because the buildup does not include raising the debt ceiling or longer-term budget cuts," says GFT Markets' Fawad Razaqzada. Dow +1.95%, S&P +1.5%, Nasdaq +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 AM | 5 Comments

  • Spanish and Italian 10-year bond yields start the year on the right note - as far as governments...

    Spanish and Italian 10-year bond yields start the year on the right note - as far as governments are concerned - with those of Spain dropping 11 bps to 5.16%, the lowest since March 20, and those of Italy dropping 17 bps to 4.35% after touching 4.34%, the lowest since December 2010. The ECB's pledge to buy sovereign debt could help the rally continue well into 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian and European stocks rally following the U.S. fiscal cliff deal, with Hong Kong and...

    Asian and European stocks rally following the U.S. fiscal cliff deal, with Hong Kong and Australia closing at their highest levels since June 2011. However, given that U.S. has hit its debt ceiling and that the agreement contains limited spending cuts, "the upside looks limited," says Piper Jaffray's Andrew Sullivan. Japan closed, Hong Kong +2.9%. China closed, Australia +1.2%, India +0.7%. EU Stoxx 50 +2.4%, London +1.4%, Paris +1.5%, Frankfurt +1.9%, Milan +1.8%, Madrid +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 AM

  • As with Asian shares, commodity prices are higher after Congress' passage of the fiscal cliff...

    As with Asian shares, commodity prices are higher after Congress' passage of the fiscal cliff deal, with gold +0.3%, silver +1.45%, copper +0.7% and oil +1%. Copper is also benefiting from generally decent PMI data out of China.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 AM
